ui_ux_improvements.title: Standardize Auth Form Input Styling
ui_ux_improvements.description: Update authentication forms (SignInForm, ForgotPasswordForm, ResetPasswordForm) to use the standard Input component instead of custom inline styling
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Auth forms use custom inline focus styles (focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 or focus:ring-amber-500) that don't match the design system's Input component. This creates visual inconsistency and maintenance burden.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Auth forms use raw <input> elements with custom Tailwind classes like 'bg-zinc-800 border border-zinc-700 rounded-lg focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-amber-500' instead of the standard Input component
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: Replace all raw <input> elements in auth forms with the <Input /> component from '@/components/ui/input', which has consistent focus:visible:border-ring focus:visible:ring-ring/50 styling matching the design system
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Consistent visual experience across the application, making the auth flow feel polished and professional. Better accessibility with standardized focus states.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Fix Footer Version Display
ui_ux_improvements.description: Update the footer version from hardcoded 'v0.8' to dynamically read from package.json or update to match current version 0.95.0
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The footer displays 'v0.8' but the actual application version in package.json is '0.95.0'. This misleads users about the current version and looks unprofessional.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Footer hardcodes 'v0.8' in layout.tsx line 73, which is significantly out of date compared to package.json version 0.95.0
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: Either: (1) Import version from package.json and display dynamically, or (2) Update the hardcoded version to 'v0.95.0'. Recommended approach is dynamic import for automatic updates: import { version } from '../../package.json' then use {version}
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users see accurate version information, which is important for bug reports and knowing they're on the latest version. Maintains trust in the application's professionalism.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Add Keyboard Shortcut Hints to Sidebar
ui_ux_improvements.description: Display keyboard shortcut indicators for the sidebar collapse toggle (Ctrl+B) so users can discover this feature
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The sidebar has a useful Ctrl+B keyboard shortcut for collapsing/expanding, but users have no way to discover this feature. Making shortcuts visible improves power user efficiency.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: The collapse button shows ChevronLeft or Menu icon but provides no hint about the Ctrl+B shortcut. Code at line 87-96 listens for the shortcut but it's invisible to users.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: Add a tooltip to the collapse button showing 'Toggle sidebar (Ctrl+B)' or add a small <kbd> style hint below the button when sidebar is expanded: <TooltipContent>Toggle sidebar<kbd className='ml-2 px-1 text-xs bg-muted rounded'>Ctrl+B</kbd></TooltipContent>
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Power users can discover and use keyboard shortcuts for faster navigation. Improves efficiency for users who work with the app frequently.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Improve Help Button Touch Target in SectionHeader
ui_ux_improvements.description: Increase the help button size in SectionHeader to meet minimum touch target guidelines of 44x44 pixels for mobile accessibility
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The help icon button uses 'p-1.5' padding creating approximately a 28x28px touch target, which is below the recommended 44x44px minimum for mobile. This makes it hard to tap accurately on touch devices.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Help button at line 135-137 uses 'className="p-1.5 rounded-full bg-background/50"' with a 4x4 icon, resulting in approximately 28x28px touch target. Also missing aria-label for screen readers.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: Change button styling to 'className="p-2.5 -m-1 rounded-full bg-background/50 hover:bg-background/80 transition-colors" aria-label="Help for this section"'. The increased padding creates a 44x44 target while negative margin keeps visual alignment. Add aria-label for accessibility.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Mobile users can accurately tap the help button without frustration. Screen reader users get clear announcement of button purpose. Complies with WCAG 2.5.5 Target Size guidelines.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Standardize Loading Spinner Component
ui_ux_improvements.description: Create a unified LoadingSpinner component and replace inconsistent loading indicators throughout the app
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Different components use varying loading indicators - some use Loader2 with amber color, others use custom border-based spinners with purple, and some have different sizes. This creates visual inconsistency.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: CommunityGrid uses '<Loader2 className="w-8 h-8 animate-spin text-muted-foreground"/>'. UnifiedImageGallery uses '<div className="w-12 h-12 ... border-t-purple-500 rounded-full animate-spin"/>'. CreditsDisplay uses '<Loader2 className="w-8 h-8 animate-spin text-amber-500"/>'. No consistent size/color scheme.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: Create a new LoadingSpinner component: export function LoadingSpinner({ size = 'md', className }: { size?: 'sm'|'md'|'lg', className?: string }) with predefined sizes (sm=4, md=8, lg=12) and use the app's amber/orange brand colors consistently. Replace all instances with <LoadingSpinner />
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Consistent loading experience across the app feels polished and professional. Users recognize the loading state immediately regardless of which feature they're using.
